metadata.title: Simai Pulao | সেমাই পোলাও | Bengali Recipies
metadata.description:
Simai Pulao by Minu Begum I রুরাল রেসিপির নবম পর্ব । পূর্ব বর্ধমানের ওয়ারিশপুরের বাসিন্দা মিনু বেগমের হাতের রান্না :  সেমাই পোলাও ।

Semai, also known as vermicelli pudding, holds a special place in Bengali cuisine as a beloved sweet dish. Language expert Pandit Sunitikumar Chattopadhyay traced the origins of the word 'semai' to the Greek term 'Semidalis,' which translates to wheat flour or maida. While 'maida' itself is a French term, 'semidalis' was adopted into Sanskrit as 'samida,' eventually evolving into 'semai. '

Traditionally, semai was handmade by women in households, using either wheat or rice flour.  Although it is now readily available in packaged form in the market, the homemade version remains cherished, particularly in the days leading up to the festival of Eid.  In various regions of Bengal, semai continues to be prepared using the traditional methods passed down through generations.

Rural local recipes are integral part of Intangible Cultural Heritage and needs to be preserved and promoted. We at banglanatak dot com have been working for the past 22+ years to safeguard and promote local cultural heritages in rural spaces across India. We are now launching a new initiative of documenting rural recipes and bringing them closer to the food lovers of the world.  We request all to subscribe to our new channel Rural Recipes and stay tuned there to know, learn and try out local delicacies.

Presenter: Debalina Bhowmick
